dict.acceptation: 他[她，它]们的；（在提及性别不详的人时，用以代替 him 或 her）；代指之前已经提到的或指向非常明显的一群人或事物的；

sent.orig: Misers put their back and their belly into their pockets.
sent.trans: 守财奴爱财如命， 宁可饿肚皮，没衣穿。

sent.orig: Their fists were clenched so tightly that their nails dug deep into their palms.
sent.trans: 他们紧握着拳头，指甲深深地捏进了手心。

sent.orig: They gave their lives for their country, and now they have no roof over their heads.
sent.trans: 他们不惜为国家献出生命，可是现在他们连住房都没有。

sent.orig: While they have not got their aims, their anxiety is how to get them; when they have got them, their anxiety is lest they should lose them.
sent.trans: 其未得之也，患得之；既得之，患失之。

sent.orig: After their quarrel, Jim and Mary found that their relationship had gone off the boil, and they were never again as loving as they had been.
sent.trans: 吵架过后，吉姆和玛丽发现，他们之间的关系已经冷了下来，再也不会像以前那么相亲相爱了。
